maml:description.maml:para: Add entries to the hosts-file
Running this command with elevated privilege. Add any entries to the hosts-file

maml:Description.maml:para: Path to the hostsfile, can be empty
IP Address to add
Hostname to add
FullyQualifiedName to add
Path to the hostsfile, can be empty
IP Address to add
Hostname to add
FullyQualifiedName to add

maml:description.maml:para: Get Network Adapter Configuration
List network adapter configuraion for all adapters
Get Network Adapters
List all network adapters
Get the content of the hostsfile
Format the content of the hostsfile to an object

maml:Description.maml:para: Path to the hostsfile, can be empty
Path to the hostsfile, can be empty

maml:description.maml:para: Get the Routing Table
Format the Routing Table to an object

maml:Description.maml:para: IPv4 or IPv6
IPv4 or IPv6

maml:description.maml:para: Remove an entry from the hostsfile
Running this command with elevated privilege.
Backup the hostsfile and remove an entry from the hostsfile

maml:Description.maml:para: Path to the hostsfile, can be empty
IP Address and hostname to remove
Path to the hostsfile, can be empty
IP Address and hostname to remove

maml:description.maml:para: Start a TCP Portlistener
Temporarily listen on a given TCP port for connections dumps connections to the screen

maml:Description.maml:para: The TCP port that the listener should attach to
MaxTimeout in milliseconds to wait, default is 5000
The TCP port that the listener should attach to
MaxTimeout in milliseconds to wait, default is 5000

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Start-PsNetPortListener -TcpPort 443, Listening on TCP port 443, press CTRL+C to cancel

maml:description.maml:para: Domain information groper
Resolves a hostname to the IP addresses or an IP Address to the hostname.

maml:Description.maml:para: Hostname or IP Address or Alias or WebUrl as String or String-Array
Hostname or IP Address or Alias or WebUrl as String or String-Array

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Resolve a hostname to the IP Address

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Resolve an array of hostnames to the IP Address

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Resolve an array of hostnames to the IP Address with ValueFromPipeline

maml:description.maml:para: Test the connectivity over a Tcp port
Test connectivity to an endpoint over the specified Tcp port

maml:Description.maml:para: One of the Tcp ports for SMB, HTTP, HTTPS, WINRM, WINRMS, LDAP, LDAPS
A String or an Array of Strings with Names or IP Addresses to test <string>
Min. Timeout in ms, default is 0
Max. Timeout in ms, default is 1000
A String or an Array of Strings with Names or IP Addresses to test <string>
An Integer or an Array of Integers with Tcp Ports to test <int>
Min. Timeout in ms, default is 0
Max. Timeout in ms, default is 1000
A String or an Array of Strings with Names or IP Addresses to test <string>
One of the Tcp ports for SMB, HTTP, HTTPS, WINRM, WINRMS, LDAP, LDAPS
An Integer or an Array of Integers with Tcp Ports to test <int>
Min. Timeout in ms, default is 0
Max. Timeout in ms, default is 1000

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Test the connectivity to one Destination and one Tcp Port with a max. timeout of 100ms

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Test the connectivity to one Destination and one CommonTcpPort with a max. timeout of 100ms

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Test the connectivity to two Destinations and one Tcp Port with a max. timeout of 100ms

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Test the connectivity to two Destinations and two Tcp Ports with a max. timeout of 100ms

maml:description.maml:para: Test the connectivity over a Udp port
Test connectivity to an endpoint over the specified Udp port

maml:Description.maml:para: A String or an Array of Strings with Names or IP Addresses to test <string>
An Integer or an Array of Integers with Udp Ports to test <int>
Min. Timeout in ms, default is 0
Max. Timeout in ms, default is 1000
A String or an Array of Strings with Names or IP Addresses to test <string>
An Integer or an Array of Integers with Udp Ports to test <int>
Min. Timeout in ms, default is 0
Max. Timeout in ms, default is 1000

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Test the connectivity to one Destination and one Udp Port with a max. timeout of 100ms

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Test the connectivity to two Destinations and one Udp Port with a max. timeout of 100ms

dev:remarks.maml:para: EXAMPLE Test the connectivity to two Destinations and two Udp Ports with a max. timeout of 100ms Test-PsNetUping -Destination sbb.ch, google.com -UdpPort 53, 139 -MaxTimeout 100

maml:description.maml:para: Test-PsNetWping
Test web request to an Url

maml:Description.maml:para: A String or an Array of Strings with Url's to test

Max. Timeout in ms, default is 1000
